context: this is a 51-year-old gentleman here with his wife.

at the office, we observed large tonsils and elongation and thickening of the uvula as well as redundant soft tissue of the palate.

a tortuous appearance of the septum also was observed.
the tonsils were first removed using electrodissection technique.
hemostasis was achieved with the electrocautery and with sutures of 0 plain catgut.

text: injection of tonsil fossae with marcaine
context: the tonsil fossae were injected with 0.25% marcaine with 1:200,000 epinephrine.

text: resection of uvula and soft palate
context: the planned anterior soft palate incision was marked out with the electrocautery from the left anterior tonsillar pillar rising upwards and then extending horizontally across the soft palate to include all of the uvula and a portion of the soft palate, and the incision then extended across the midline and then inferiorly to meet the right anterior tonsillar pillar.
closure of the soft palate wound was then accomplished with interrupted 3-0 chromic catgut sutures.
mucoperichondrium and mucoperiosteum were elevated with the cottle elevator.

text: resection of deflected portion of septal bone
context: the right-sided mucoperiosteum was elevated with the freer elevator and then with takahashi forceps and with the 4 mm osteotome, the deflected portion of the septal bone from the vomer was resected.

text: closure of nasal septal mucosal flaps
context: the nasal septal mucosal flaps were then sutured together with a quilting suture of 4-0 plain catgut.
the inferior turbinates were then both outfractured using a knife handle.
the nose and throat were irrigated with saline and suctioned.
an orogastric tube was placed and a moderate amount of clear fluid suctioned from the stomach and this tube was removed.
sponge and needle count were reported correct.
estimated blood loss was about 15-20 cc.
